thread.title: Steelers receiver Bryant humbled after 4-game suspension
thread.title_full: Steelers receiver Bryant humbled after 4-game suspension

title: Steelers receiver Bryant humbled after 4-game suspension
text:
Steelers receiver Martavis Bryant chastened following 4-game suspension: 'I learned from it' By WILL GRAVES AP Sports Writer First Posted: October 05, 2015 - 3:21 pmLast Updated: October 05, 2015 - 3:21 pm We also have more stories about: (click the phrases to see a list) 
Organizations: 
Pennsylvania (896) 

PITTSBURGH â€” Pittsburgh Steelers wide receiver Martavis Bryant is back on the practice field following his four-game suspension for violating the NFL's substance abuse policy. 
Bryant was cleared to return after last Thursday's 23-20 loss to Baltimore. The second-year receiver spent three weeks getting counseling in Houston at a facility operated by former NBA player and coach John Lucas. 
Bryant says he learned from his mistakes and has a better understanding on how to avoid them in the future. 
The Steelers (2-2) have a week to get ready for a trip to San Diego. Bryant's presence should help an offense that had trouble getting downfield against the Ravens. Bryant averaged 21 yards a catch during his rookie season, scoring eight touchdowns in 10 games. 
AP NFL website: http://www.pro32.ap.org and http://twitter.com/AP_NFL
